sample math file

06 Oct 2012

you can do awesome things with maths:

$f(|I_2|)=\left| \int_{0}^T \psi(t) \left\{ u(a,t)- \int_{\gamma(t)}^a \frac{d\theta}{k(\theta,t)} \int_{a}^\theta c(\xi)u_t(\xi,t)\,d\xi \right\} dt \right|$

Like write out all the greek letters.
$\alpha,
\beta, \gamma, \Gamma,
\delta,\Delta,
\epsilon, \zeta, \eta, \theta, \Theta, \kappa,
\lambda, \Lambda, \mu, \nu,
\xi, \Xi,
\pi, \Pi,
\rho,
\sigma,
\tau,
\phi, \Phi,
\chi,
\psi, \Psi,
\omega, \Omega$

And make things look pretty.

Draw derivatives
\begin{equation}
\frac{dy}{dx} = \lim_{\Delta x \to 0} \frac{\Delta y}
{\Delta x}
\end{equation}
\begin{equation}
f(x) \to y \quad \mbox{as} \quad x \to
x_{0}
\end{equation}
\begin{equation}
f(x) \mathop {\longrightarrow}
\limits_{x \to x_0} y
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
\log_{10}f \simeq n
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
f(x)\sim 10^{n}
\end{equation}

Approximate equality:
\begin{equation}
f(x)\simeq g(x)
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
f(x) \propto x^3 .
\end{equation}
